summary: The Diagnostics Testing Preparedness Plan Act of 2025 mandates the Secretary of Health and Human Services to develop and maintain a plan for the rapid development, distribution, and scaling of diagnostic tests during public health emergencies, including those related to emerging infectious diseases. The plan aims to improve coordination among public and private entities, facilitate the use of new testing technologies, and address medical supply needs. The Secretary must consider domestic capacity, distribution strategies, and conduct drills. The plan must be released within a year of enactment and updated every three years.
